node.text:
We envision cities where youth are actively involved in civic planning, shaping, and decision-making. Through programs like the North Shore Young Citizens' Forum, we convene youth-led, youth-friendly cohorts to build civic literacy, make social connections, and learn how to affect community change. 

üîó Check out our final report from our most recent Forum cohort in our bio. Thanks to our partners at North Shore Community Resources! 

#NorthShore

üìö Looking for a weekend read? Check out Engaging Black People & Power by placemaker, author and Canadian Urban Institute's Senior Fellow of Equity-Based Placemaking, Jay Pitter. 

This publication was written in collaboration with students and scholars in York University's Faculty of Environmental and Urban Change. It focuses on engagement practices and policy approaches for addressing spatialized anti-Blackness in cities across North America. Link in our bio.

#CitiesForAll

Looking for an exciting job with real impact? We're hiring a full-time Operations and Special Projects Lead! üåü

This role is a unique blend of overseeing internal operations and supporting the delivery of youth engagement projects. You're a great candidate if you: 

‚òëÔ∏èAre excited about being the core part of a small team at a key time of organizational growth
‚òëÔ∏èAre skilled in project management, organization, operations and team culture
‚òëÔ∏èHave strong value alignment with JEDDI (justice, equity, diversity, decolonization and inclusion) principles
 ‚òëÔ∏èAre excited about hands-on work supporting youth engagement programming and strengthening youth engagement practices across Metro Vancouver

Sound like you or someone you know? Check out our posting at the link in our bio and apply by April 18th. 

#NowHiring #Jobs #YVRJobs

Say hi to our Civic Education Coordinator, Rowan, and her very professional office buddy, Bella! üëã

"Now that it's been a full year of working from home, I think I finally have my routine dialled in. Highlights include:

‚òÅÔ∏è Fluffy blankets
üïØÔ∏è Scented candles
üê∂ Puppy cuddles

I also drink lots of water and earl grey tea to keep me going throughout the day. A nice view out the window and scenic desktop background pics don't hurt either!"

#WorkFromHome #NonProfit #YouthLed #WFH

The final report from our City Shapers: Resilient Communities cohort last summer is live! It's always a thrill to see the real impact that our work has on youth from across Metro Vancouver. This unique program: 

üì£ used a knowledge-to-action framework
üì£ convened 30 participants virtually
üì£ brought in thought leaders from fields such as resilience and emergency response
üì£ supported the development of 6 youth-led, resilience-focused projects

Read our full City Shapers report at the link in our bio. Special thank you to our wonderful partners at SFU Morris J. Wosk Centre for Dialogue and the generous support of the Vancouver Foundation.

RADIUS Fellowship applications are open from March 15th to April 28th! Two members of the CityHive team have participated in previous cohorts, and we highly recommend it. üéñÔ∏è

The Fellowship presents an unparalleled opportunity for emerging social innovators to deepen their conscious leadership capacities, build a network of like-minded peers, and connect with a vibrant community of change-makers along the way! 

Sound exciting? Head to their website to learn more or register for their information session on Wednesday, March 31st. üîóradiussfu.com/fellows

One of our favourite parts about running youth-focused programs is being consistently inspired by our creative, innovative participants! üí´ 

Check out these 6 unique project ideas that emerged from our recent Envirolab cohort on #ZeroWaste and #CircularEconomy üëá

1Ô∏è‚É£ Restaurant Buddies: Creating a platform that facilitates the sharing of common practices and strategies to reduce food waste in the restaurant industry.

2Ô∏è‚É£ Farmateers: Examining ways to make food waste personal and showcase the value of local CSA boxes to support behaviour shifts as individuals, households and communities.

3Ô∏è‚É£ Deconstruct The City: Designing a series of workshops to bring together leaders and changemakers in the construction industry and accelerate the business case for designing for deconstruction.

4Ô∏è‚É£ Communicycle: Examining the use of mealworms as a viable solution to address the soft plastics and styrofoam waste problem in Metro Vancouver.

5Ô∏è‚É£ RePillable: Developing an accessible, community-based reusable pill bottle program that provides consumers with reusable and refillable prescription bottles. 

6Ô∏è‚É£ Circular Construction Economy: A mobile app dedicated towards educating homeowners and community members on circular economy categories that positively impact construction practices.

Check out these events happening tomorrow and Friday! 

üëâ  Youth Leadership in Non-Profits with Vantage Point
üëâ Affordable Housing + Labour in Vancouver with Changemakers Across BC 
üëâ UBC Reads Sustainability with Nobel Prize nominee Sheila Watt-Cloutier

This is Kathryn, our Sustainability Programs Lead! üëã She just wrapped up our #Envirolab cohort on zero waste and circular economies. We asked her to share a bit about her work from home routine. üëá

"Each day starts off with all employees in my household (ME.MYSELF. AND I.) hosting a check-in meeting to get set for the day ahead. The morning team meeting includes:

üçµ a quality cup of peppermint tea
üéß some soft lo-fi beats
ü§∏‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èa reminder to ‚Äústand up and stretch‚Äù by 10:15 

Making time to move during the day helps me stay focused and present throughout the day. Not pictured here: the tired work partner (AKA my dog Milo) after our morning stroll."

#JobLove #WFH #WorkFromHome #NonProfit #CityHive #YouthLed

We're standing in solidarity with the Asian community now and always. There are many Asian-led organizations to learn with and from in the aftermath of last week's tragedy, but we'd like to amplify two local, youth-led groups in particular: 

üíô @coldteacollective: Stories for, by, and about Asian millennials 
üíô @huafoundation: Youth empowerment non-profit at the intersection of cultural heritage and social change. 

Check out their reflections and generous teachings on their pages. 

#StopAsianHate

Are you between the age of 18 and 30? Do you live, work, or spend time in Kits, Fairview or Mount Pleasant? Don't miss Monday's opportunity to shape the future of the Broadway area. üèôÔ∏è 

The @cityofvancouver is teaming up with @langaracollege's Applied Planning students and @citystudiovan to host a virtual youth-focused engagement workshop on March 22nd at 6:00pm. 

Link in bio. üîó

#vancouver #planningvancouvertogether #shapeyourcity #broadwayplan #langaracollege #citystudiovan #cityofvancouver

Join our very own Civic Education Coordinator Rowan as she speaks next Thursday at this sweet SFU Morris J. Wosk Centre for Dialogue event! 

In 2019, the Centre found that 60% of Canadians thought their civic education was insufficient. We agree‚Äîbut there's hope! Learn about successful and emergent experiments in civic education such as Participatory Budgeting, the Canadian Ethics Bowl, and ‚Äúknowledge-to-action‚Äù models that we use in our own CityHive programs. Rowan will be joined by an excellent panel of speakers. 

üîó Register for free in our bio.

Our second North Shore Young Citizens' Forum with @nscrconnect was a success! We brought together residents ages 18-40 from all three North Shore municipalities to: 

üìà increase civic literacy
üí≠ learn about municipal decision-making
üí° co-create recommendations to present to council

Want to learn more about the Forum and our civic education programming? Read the full report at the link in our bio. üîó

We wrapped up our #CivicEducation program last week with the @cityofrichmondbc by hosting a Mock Council for our youth participants! Our three project teams presented their ideas to Mayor Malcolm Brodie and city councillors Alexa Loo Page, Michael Wolfe, and Chak Au ÂçÄÊæ§ÂÖâ. These youth-led ideas focused on: 

üí°Hosting pop-up recycling depots once a month in the Hamilton neighbourhood to increase access
üí°Suggesting a cassava-based bag to Richmond's businesses to reduce plastic use 
üí°Instating a youth advisory committee on cultural sharing to increase collaboration between the City and Richmond's many high school multicultural groups 

All attendees were impressed by the depth of our cohort's understanding and requested their slide decks to review proposals further. We're proud of how this program went with this inaugural virtual cohort, and can't wait to see the change they continue making in Richmond and beyond. üåü

#YouthLed #Richmond #RichmondBC

Join students, staff, and community leaders for this Friday's event at 11am hosted by @ubcsustainability! Together, you'll explore the relationship between grassroots climate justice activism and government policy, and how advocacy can translate into action.

Discussion will include reflections on what climate justice means to each panelist and how they build it into their work; the process of translating climate justice activism and advocacy into government action; and the role of citizens and social movements in bringing about climate justice focused government action.

Featuring:
üó£Ô∏è Andrea Reimer (Former City Councillor and Deputy Mayor, City of Vancouver; Adjunct Professor of Practice at the School of Public Policy and Global Affairs, UBC)
üó£Ô∏è Bowinn Ma (B.C. Minister of State for Infrastructure; MLA North Vancouver-Lonsdale)
üó£Ô∏è Christine Boyle (City of Vancouver Councillor; United Church Minister)
üó£Ô∏è Khelsilem (Council Member & Spokesperson for the Squamish Nation Council)

We said goodbye to our third #Envirolab cohort this week with a final virtual gathering.‚ù£Ô∏è 

Our participants reflected on how much they enjoyed having a dedicated and safe space to come to each week where conversations were focused on how to work collectively towards creating a better world. They're walking away from this experience feeling inspired by their peers, connected to others in this space, knowledgeable about how to take on new projects and excited that they are being taken seriously as experts in their own right.

This group has such a unique sense of drive and passion that they brought with them each week, and we can't wait to see where they grow from here. ‚ú®

#InnovationLab #VirtualProgram #CommunityBuilding #YouthLed #MetroVancouver #ZeroWaste #CircularEconomy

Last night‚Äôs #CivicEducation workshop on public washrooms with @urbanariumvan Studio was a success! So amazing to see groups design their ideas in real time. ‚úèÔ∏è illustration by the talented @elkplan

Our civic education program with the City of Richmond wraps up tonight! We're sad to say goodbye to this cohort, but blown away by the learning that's happened in a short 8 weeks. 

Tonight, the program ends with our participants presenting their three project ideas to Mayor and council in a mock council presentation. After learning with 14 different guests from nearly every department, these projects are focused on #sustainability initiatives and #culturalsharing. 

The future is #YouthLed! üõ∞Ô∏è üéâ

#CivicEducation #RichmondBC #Municipal #LocalGovernment #Leadership

üìçJoin the City of Vancouver for one of six participatory mapping workshops to provide input on how we can strengthen our neighbourhoods as part of the #VancouverPlan.

ü§ê Also, we're thrilled to be developing youth-focused materials for Vancouver Plan engagement‚Äîstay tuned for us to unveil what we've been working on. 

üîó Registration link in our bio.

#CityOfVancouver #YouthEngagement #CityPlanning #YVR

Check out this UBC Reads Sustainability event on Thursday from 12:00-2:00pm with UBC Sustainability!  Join author Amitav Ghosh for a conversation on the human inability to grasp the scale and violence of climate change and the need to imagine beyond our current forms of existence to challenge the extremity of today‚Äôs climate events.

And that's a wrap on our third Envirolab cohort! ü§Øüò¢ü§©

Our final night of Envirolab Presents: Zero Waste + Circular Economies opened beautifully with a welcome from Xwechtaal of the Squamish Nation. 

Then, we heard presentations from our three project teams‚Äî  Communicycle, Circular Construction Economies, and Farmateersgave‚Äîas well as a panel of sustainability experts on how to rethink waste as consumers. 

We're so grateful to all of you who attended one of both of these events, and for the incredible CityHive community that keeps growing with each program. ‚ù£Ô∏è

#YouthLed #ZeroWaste #CircularEconomy

üöæ Join us at this event on public washrooms next Wednesday in collaboration with Urbanarium! 

üöΩ  Access to public washrooms is a basic need that doesn't receive the attention it deserves in our communities. Municipalities across Canada, including Vancouver, are developing washroom strategies and plans.

üåÄ  The Urbanarium Studio is an urban design workshop place hosted by a collective of planners, designers and architects, and this event will be facilitated by 5 powerhouse CityHive community members. 

üé´  Link in bio to register.

#CityPlanning #YouthLed #EquityCenteredDesign

Are you 14-22 and figuring out what you want your life and impact to look like? Check out 4better2morrow [@4b_2m]'s upcoming #FutureLabs to support youth from across the globe to explore, ideate and activate your desirable futures. The first event is coming up this weekend! üõ∞Ô∏è

Last week was our last content-focused session before project planning in our #CivicEducation program with the City of Richmond! Our youth cohort heard about community safety, recreation, and cultural harmony. Check out this JamBoard that captures their thoughts on what it means to be included. 

#Inclusion #YouthLed #YVR

Last week's #EnvirolabPresents event left us so energized and inspired. Good news‚Äîwe've got one more night for you! 

Join us and our remaining three project teams this Wednesday, March 3rd to reimagine waste as consumers. It's sure to be another evening full of youth-driven ideas, meaningful conversation, and opportunities for connection with folks across the zero waste, sustainability and circular economy networks in Metro Vancouver. 

We have limited tickets left. Register in our bio. üéüÔ∏è

Attention! Applications for the Women4Climate (W4C) program are open now. This unique mentorship opportunity aims to advance bold, local climate action in alignment with Vancouver's Climate Emergency Action Plan, and contributes to the next generation of climate leaders through a mentorship program dedicated to women working in climate to create a healthier, greener, more resilient, and economically prosperous urban future. In 2019, Vancouver became the eighth city to launch a local C40 Women4Climate Mentorship Program. 

More at @cityofvancouver and @greenestcity. #Climate #ClimateAction

üõçÔ∏èAre you frustrated by how today's mainstream economic models fail to recognize the cyclical potential of products? Overwhelmed by the incessant obsession with creating 'stuff'? Anxious to shake up the status quo before it's too late? 

‚ôªÔ∏èJoin us this Wednesday, February 24th for Night 1 of Envirolab Presents: Zero Waste + Circular Economies. You'll hear from 3 of our innovative, youth-led project teams sharing their ideas for rethinking waste at the source, then have a chance to discuss your thoughts with other sustainability learners and professionals. 

‚û°Ô∏èLink in our bio.

#YouthLed Win: We got to host a dialogue between a group of youth ages 14-18 from across BC and @BCHydro recently, including their President and CEO, Chris O'Reily! Our group discussed energy futures and gave BC Hydro valuable input for their 2040 planning process. üîã

Is she ever NOT moderating a cool conversation?! ü§©

Join our Executive Director Veronika next Thursday, February 25th for Future Economy: Prosperous, Sustainable and Resilient, hosted by @SFUPublicSquare in partnership with the @CityOfVancouver. Let's envision better futures, together! Link in our bio to register for free.

Amazing program alert! Our friends at @UBCCapacity are launching their first workshop series to transform the way BIPOC individuals are engaged in civic processes and shaping our communities. Join a cohort of 15-20 like-minded students for hands-on learning in the field of city-building and planning, guidance and advice from industry professionals and mentors, and skill development. City planners, community leaders, and folks from public policy will lead workshops that equip participants to be changemakers in their communities. Apply for their program by heading to their profile.

In the spirit of #FamilyDay, we want to shine a spotlight on a member of our team! Rowan has officially been with CityHive for a year as Civic Education Program Coordinator. Despite only being in her role a month before transitioning to virtual work, Rowan has led three cohort programs, a variety of other events and initiatives, and is described by team members as an incredibly supportive and thoughtful colleague who holds space for others, brings a keen eye for detail, and always goes the extra mile. Show her some love in the comments üíå
Gong Xi Fa Cai! On behalf of the entire CityHive team and Board, we‚Äôre wishing you and your loved ones a wonderful, safe #LunarNewYear and long weekend. ü•∞üí´

Cheers to Envirolab Cohort 3! ü•Ç

Last night was our last formal program session with the group before our upcoming public event Envirolab Presents: Zero Waste & Circular Economies. This cohort has dreamed up 6 unique projects to help drive Metro Vancouver forward on these issues. Don't miss out on being a part of this urgent conversation‚Äîregister for Envirolab Presents now! 

üé´  Free tickets at the link in our bio üé´  #CircularEconomy #ZeroWaste #MetroVancouver #Envirolab #CityHive #Community

The legacy of planning for most neighbourhoods on unceded territories in the @CityOfVancouver is one of exclusion and displacement based on income, race, ability and other elements of our identities. Today, many would argue that their neighbourhoods are not ‚Äúcomplete.‚Äù

Join @sfupublicsquare for this event next Wednesday to hear from a stellar panel who think about neighbourhoods from different perspectives. The City will also be collecting your thoughts for Planning Vancouver Together on how we can feel closer to home in all of Vancouver‚Äôs neighbourhoods.
Our #CivicEducation program with @cityofrichmondbc made the @richmond_news! So energized by this cohort of wonderful young folks. Check out the article at the link in our bio.

We're thrilled to invite you to Envirolab Presents: Ideas for #ZeroWaste & Circular Economies! ‚ôªÔ∏è üîµ

This event is the culmination of our third Envirolab cohort on zero waste and the #circulareconomy, and will be hosted over two nights: 

Night 1 (February 24th): Rethinking Waste at the Source
Night 2 (March 3rd): Rethinking Waste as Consumers
 
You‚Äôll hear from our six creative and innovative teams of youth aged 18-30, who‚Äôve developed projects to address gaps and opportunities in zero waste and circular economies across Metro Vancouver. You‚Äôll also get to share comments alongside a panel of sustainability professionals and to connect with other interested community members! 

Register for free at the link in our bio.

Our #DistantNotDisengaged series with @sfupublicsquare and @sfudialogue emerged as a response to the uncertainty and isolation created by the pandemic last April. We‚Äôre so proud of what we accomplished in 2020: 17 events over 9 months, with 70+ guest speakers and over 2,500 participants. It was a special opportunity to engage with neighbours and strangers about a variety of timely issues. Check out this sweet series recap video! Full thing at the link in our bio. üé•

Last night was session three of our new youth civic education program with the @cityofrichmondbc. Some highlights:

1. Mayor Malcolm Brodie joined our cohort for a half hour chat about what it's like to be in municipal politics. The group had lots of questions, including one asking him about the most famous person he'd ever met while in office. (Answer: the Queen üëë).

2. After a break, we were joined by Jason Kita, Richmond's Director of Corporate Programs and Intergovernmental Relations. Jason dug into the Strategic Plan with our participants, and then we had small-group discussions on how a specific part of that plan influenced their lives and could better serve the unique needs of youth. üß†

So energized by all the learning happening here, and excited to see what's next!

Our ED Veronika collaborated with @youthclimatelab and @ClimateCaucus to build create a comprehensive guide for taking #ClimateAction at the municipal level. 

The Infiltration Manual aims to demystify municipal governance structures and provide youth with practical knowledge and tools on how to take climate action locally.

To learn more about the Infiltration Manual, check out the link in our bio! #InfiltrationManual #LocalClimateAction #PolicyInfiltration

Celebrate 10 hometown heroes (both individuals and organizations) with the City of Vancouver! We'd like to amplify the work of a few friends of CityHive, in particular: 

‚û°Ô∏è Markiel and the folks at BC Community Alliance, who are advocating for a more comprehensive K-12 Provincial curriculum that showcases Canadian Black History and the inclusion of anti-racism training for all teachers and staff throughout the province

‚û°Ô∏è Anthonia Ogundele, who started Ethos Lab and is an occasional speaker in our cohort programming

Thank you all for the incredible work you do to make our cities better! Link in our bio.

#BlackHistoryMonth #BlackLeaders #BlackYouth

Ready to start your entrepreneurial journey and bring your idea to life? Our friends at @leagueofinnovators are offering the Foundations idea incubator, a FREE 6-week virtual program to build your concept from idea to action. With weekly live sessions, open office hours, course modules, and a community of like-minded entrepreneurs across Canada, Foundations provides you with the tools to validate and launch your ideas and grow as an entrepreneur. Applications are open until February 14‚Äîmore on their page! #NextGeneration #YoungLeaders

Check out some of the reflections our youth participants had after this week's civic education session with the City of Richmond! 

This past week's theme was "What's A City, Anyway?!" Our cohort gained clarity on the different levels of government (a big public education learning gap!), learned about various historical narratives of Richmond and what stories do/don't get preserved in archives, and then had a budget breakdown workshop with a finance staff member. 

Stay tuned for more updates from this group. üèôÔ∏è

Opportunity share! If you're a UBC graduate student, apply before January 31st to be a #Sustainability Scholar. Through this innovative paid internship, successful applicants are matched with a sustainability partner to work on applied research projects that advance sustainability across the region. Check it out at @UBCSustainability.

@vanartlink is hiring a part-time digital engagement coordinator! They're a CityHive alum group that fosters collaboration and capacity building within Vancouver's arts + culture community. We're proud of the work they initiated in our City Shapers program and know you'll love being a part of this team. ü§©

Apply before this Sunday at the link in their bio!

Do you know someone who uses dialogue to advance anti-racism systems change? Encourages mutual understanding between diverse perspectives? Holds space for people to work together cooperatively? 

üåüNominate this deserving leader for the SFU Morris J. Wosk Centre for Dialogue's Jack P. Blaney Award for Dialogue! üåü

The recipient(s) will receive a cash reward, as well as the opportunity for a residency to build upon their existing work. Learn more on @sfudialogue's page and nominate before February 5th.

We were so fortunate to have a stacked panel join us last week for our Envirolab session on mentorship and feedback! We had guests from Vancity, Vancouver Economic Commission, Master Recycler Vancouver, One Earth, Sea to Sky Removal, Michael Green Architecture and the Share Reuse Repair Initiative. 

We have 6 project teams working on a variety of ideas, like:

‚ôªÔ∏è apps to support sourcing green and sustainable building materials
‚ôªÔ∏è developing dehydrated meals from imperfect produce
‚ôªÔ∏è rethinking medical waste
‚ôªÔ∏è so much more!

üí•If you're between ages 14-18, don't miss this: today is your last chance to apply for our paid upcoming workshops on BC's energy future with @BCHydro! 

From smartphones to dishwashers, electricity is central to our daily lives. BC Hydro is currently looking for public input on their 2040 planning process, and needs your vision for answering questions like "Will your future be defined by smart homes, electric cars, and clean energy? Or something different?"

‚ö° Feb 2 or 4, 4:00-5:30pm
‚ö° Virtual (On Zoom)
‚ö° Honorarium provided to all participants 

Apply before midnight at the link in our bio.

Found this one on our camera roll from the summer picnic we had with the full CityHive team and Board! There was one person in attendance who wasn't too keen to socialize...but the rest of us had a great time. 

#Bernauguration

Our team was nominated for the #RenewDemocracy challenge to share what democracy means to us by @shaunavancouver and the @sfudialogue team! All six members of the CityHive staff team participated. We nominate @apathyisboring, @citystudiovan and @sustainabiliteens to go next! üòé

The @vanparkboard is currently recruiting participants for an advisory group to support the community engagement and design process for a new waterfront park! Let's get youth voices represented‚Äîyou can apply before January 25th. üå≥

MORE INFO: The project area, unofficially called East Park, includes a new park at the east end of Olympic Village and a portion of the False Creek shoreline between the Creekside Community Centre and Science World. The advisory group will help with the process of coming up with a concept plan that can be supported by Indigenous Rights-holders, stakeholders, and residents. The East Park Advisory Group is expected to meet virtually four times in 2021, on Tuesday evenings from 6-8pm.
